metadata.title: USN-2644-1 -- Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerability
metadata.description: Philip Pettersson discovered a privilege escalation when using overlayfs mounts inside of user namespaces. A local user could exploit this flaw to gain administrative privileges on the system.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-2644-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-3.16.0-41-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 linux-image-extra-3.16.0-41-generic - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-41-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-41-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-41-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-41-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-41-lowlatency - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-41-generic - 3.16.0-41.55~14.04.1 No subscription required
